item.title: Exercises in NaNoWriMo
item.description:
Solidarity, brothers and sisters!

Over the course of November, many aspiring writers, and current writers who want to flex their authorial muscles, will be taking part in National Novel Writing Month, or NaNoWriMo. Their shared target is to write 50,000 words in thirty days, in the hope of having the bulk of a serviceable, editable novel by the end of it.

read more
item.dc:creator: jp

item.title: Spineless Book Reviews on QlL
item.description:
Bringing all our literary eggs into one basket, so here's a good few dozen of the buggers.

The erstwhile contents of Spineless Reviews are now available on QlL: pushing 100 miscellaneous book reviews for your delectation.

read more
item.dc:creator: jp

item.title: In with the old!
item.description:
Think of it more like recycling than rehashing

While I work on new content, I've decided to bring older work into QlL, that for some reason never appeared here at the time. So the more dedicated readers might spot some apparently new bits and pieces appearing that they recognise. It'll tide you over till I pull my finger out, anyway.
item.dc:creator: jp

item.title: QlL on new server
item.description:
We've moved, but you should still see us

QlL has recently moved to a new server. We've been chasing a few missing images and other broken links, and we think we've got all but a handful of glitches ironed out. Please let us know if you see anything broken.
item.dc:creator: jp

item.title: Shipment of Exercises in Song in the post: some copies left
item.description:
If you haven't already put your name down for one, here's your narrow window of opportunity.

Today we posted all orders for Exercises in Song 2008. That means that they should all arrive in time for Christmas!

If you're interested in having a free print copy of the twenty-five exercises (plus four bonus ones) then you can still order a copy until Saturday 20 December and it should arrive before Christmas.
item.dc:creator: admin

item.title: QlL announces: Exercises in Song
item.description:
The third Pocketful of Lies is announced, in detail

Imagine singing the same song, ninety-nine different ways. Taking a popular English folk song and rewriting it so that it exemplifies the style "Metaphorically", or so that it resembles an official complaint letter, or so that groups of letters are rearranged by mathematical formula.

read more
item.dc:creator: admin

item.title: Sneak preview of APoL#3
item.description:
Are you ready? Here you go!

To wet your whistle, we've got a sneak preview of next month's Pocketful of Lies..

Are you ready? Here it is:

item.dc:creator: admin

item.title: Orders accepted for the third Pocketful of Lies
item.description:
We're now ready. More or less.

You can now order a free print copy of the third Pocketful of Lies using our order form. Anyone already on our mailing list from Stones and Bones should receive a copy automatically; if you're in that category, but would like to use that form to either say hello or update your address, then please do so anyway.

read more
item.dc:creator: admin

item.title: QlL on LiveJournal
item.description:
That's all, really.

Thanks to LJ user j4, QlL now has a presence on LiveJournal. Those of you who are reading this on LiveJournal will already know that; those of you who don't probably won't care.It's therefore not at all clear why we're even telling you this, apart from to say to our recent crop of new readers: hello!
item.dc:creator: jp

item.title: QlL blog
item.description:
Well, of course we've got a blog. About time too.

QlL has finally crawled into the twenty-first century with its own blog. Everyone's got one these days, of course, so there's nothing to be particularly excited there. But it'll give us a chance to air some less formal breeze-shooting, rather than always resorting to a piece of, well, art, we suppose.

read more
item.dc:creator: jp
